controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.ObjectFocusListener
      • controller.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Draw, FocusListener

    public class Controller
extends ObjectFocusListener
implements Draw
    The controller class is a link between the model and the view. It accepts input and converts it to commands for the model or view.
    Author:
    groep 03

      • paintScreen

        public void paintScreen(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        This method will loop over all the components and paint them on the window. It paints the components all on the same height on a sequence diagram and at the clicked position on a communication diagram.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics

      • handleKeyEvent

        public void handleKeyEvent(int id,
                           int keyCode,
                           char keyChar)
        When a keyevent occurs, it is handled in this method. If tab is pressed, the view of the diagram is switched, from communication to sequence and vice versa, if delete is pressed (or backspace on a mac, which doesn't have a deletebutton) the focused party gets deleted.
        Parameters:
        id - keyEvent id
        keyCode: - Keyboard key pressed
        keyChar: - keyboard key pressed keyChar
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal id or keyCode

      • handleMouseEvent

        public void handleMouseEvent(int id,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             int clickCount)
        When a mouse event occurs, it is handled in this method. If the mouse is pressed, the object is focused, if it's dragged, the object should move (if it's a party), if the mouse has clicked, it gets focused or unfocused at one click, it draws a new party.
        Parameters:
        id - mouseEvent id
        x: - coordinate x
        y: - coordinate y
        clickCount: - the number of times the mouse has clicked.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal id, coordinates or clickCount

      • labelClickedParty

        public boolean labelClickedParty(Party component,
                                 int x,
                                 int y)
        This methods checks if a label was clicked
        Parameters:
        component - the component whose location is checked
        x - x coordinate of the clicked event
        y - y coordinate of the clicked event
        Returns:
        true if the label of the component is clicked, false if the label of the component isn't clicked

      • checkCoordinate

        public Party checkCoordinate(int x,
                             int y)
        The coordinates are sent to the controller and checked, when a clickevent occurs.
        Parameters:
        x: - x coordinate
        y: - y coordinate
        Returns:
        a party.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal coordinates

      • switchDiagram

        public void switchDiagram()
        Diagram is switched. If the previous screen showed a sequence diagram, it will now show a communication diagram, and vice versa.

      • addParty

        public void addParty(Party party)
        The party gets added to the view (and to an arrayList).
        Parameters:
        party: - the party to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal party

      • removeParty

        public void removeParty(Party party)
        The party gets removed from the view (and the arrayList).
        Parameters:
        party: - the party to be deleted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal party

      • changeParty

        public void changeParty(Party party,
                        int x,
                        int y)
        The party changes from actor to object and vice versa. The party is deleted from the view and the other party is added at the same coordinates.
        Parameters:
        party: - the first party.
        x: - x coordinate of the first party.
        y: - y coordinate of the first party.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal party or coordinates

      • addMessage

        public void addMessage(Message message)
        A message is added.
        Parameters:
        message: - the message to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal message

      • removeMessage

        public void removeMessage(Message message)
        A message gets removed.
        Parameters:
        message: - the message to removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal message

      • removeComponent

        public void removeComponent(DiagramComponent component)
        A component gets removed.
        Parameters:
        component: - the component to removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal DiagramComponent
